author: Staff Reporter
text:
Chief Educational Officer (CEO) S. Gobidoss has instructed school headmasters not to permit teachers to visit the office of the CEO during working hours.

In a circular issued on March 1, the CEO said that many teachers visit the office for carrying out various works during school hours. “This affects the studies of the students”, the circular said.

Despite asking the headmasters not to send teachers during school hours, the situation continues.

Either the assistant or junior assistant should be sent for such works, the circular said.

The CEO warned that if violations continued, action would be taken against the headmasters.

However, the circular came as a shocking for many teachers who questioned the necessity of such circular when Plus Two examinations begin on Thursday.

‘On duty’

They said that many computer teachers and senior teachers were ‘On Duty’ during working hours as they were engaged in work in the office of the Chief Educational Officer.

In the absence of such teachers, other teachers should engage the classes. “The circular should have been sent at the beginning of the academic year and not at the end of the year”, they added.
title: CEO’s circular shocks teachers
